feature.name: daily_wage_calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily_wage_calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days, requiring manual tracking and interventions for overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat payroll system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: Significant product gap in attendance-driven salary calculation, with no support for automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not active. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed monthly salary

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and reduced gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks dynamic leap year recognition in service period computations.

known_issues.title: Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations. The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation shows slight differences from manual calculations due to complex service duration and daily wage formula
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves multiple tiers and prorated calculations for service duration
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparency in how partial years and service duration tiers are calculated

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Considering Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), potentially causing minor discrepancies in service duration calculations. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Calculation in Gratuity Computation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates one extra day in job tenure (622 vs 623 days), potentially affecting gratuity calculation precision. The platform captures 623 days instead of the expected 622 days when computing years of service.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation may cause slight variations in gratuity amount
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential precision issue in days worked calculation logic

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. Users may misunderstand how daily wage is divided (31 vs 30 days) and resulting prorated salary amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary month-to-month due to different working day counts
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a consistent method for calculating leave salary accruals across months with varying working days

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Working days calculation depends entirely on work week configuration

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When processing payroll earlier than the departure date, the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic does not handle dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates different from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a timing mismatch between Payroll and Time Off modules causing incorrect daily wage calculations. The system cannot recalculate deductions retroactively, leading to inconsistent salary deduction amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in the remarks section for February unpaid leave calculations, despite the backend calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave deductions. Instead of using Basic Salary / Working Days as configured, the system uses a global daily rate that calculates deductions using gross salary, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display Across Payroll Months
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system recalculates daily rates based on the payroll processing month instead of storing and displaying the rate from the original leave occurrence month, causing user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not consistently show the rate from the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. The payroll-side configuration always takes precedence.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify the daily wage formula in leave policy when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Config Dependency in Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Counting
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years during service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potentially underpays end of service gratuity by miscalculating total working days

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations consistently produce amounts that are 0.1 or 0.2 less than expected when computing pro-rated End of Service amounts.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in employee final settlements

limitations.title: Limited Mid-Month Leave Accrual Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at the end of the month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include current month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Service Duration Calculation Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculations

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Computation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform uses a fixed divisor for daily wage calculation based on policy configuration, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the daily rate divisor to account for different month lengths or unique leave scenarios

limitations.title: Monthly Variation in Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment calculations are based on working days, which means the daily wage rate changes each month depending on the number of working days
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ month-to-month due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot be automatically aligned
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between leave salary and regular salary proration

limitations.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration calculation may differ based on unique work week setups

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration works correctly only when departure date is in the past, but fails when departure date is in the future
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for offboarded employees

limitations.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically reconcile or remove payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified or deleted.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations and requires precise tracking of working days

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave policy uses a fixed 30.42 day divisor instead of calendar days for daily wage calculation
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not precisely match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual calendar days in a month, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deductions by using the precise number of calendar days for each month

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

Leave days are earned and available only at the end of each month, not prorated for partial months

The number of days used to calculate the daily wage in leave salary calculations, typically configured in the leave policy (e.g., 30 or 31 days)
Cumulative calculation of vacation leave monetary value, which can vary based on monthly working days when using the 'working days' calculation method
The number of days used to calculate the daily rate of salary (can be 30 or 30.42 days depending on the specific calculation method)
Days considered for salary calculation, which can be configured to include all 7 days of the week depending on work week setup
Partial salary calculation based on actual days worked, calculated by dividing monthly salary by total days in month and multiplying by days worked
Salary reduction applied when an employee takes leave without pay, which can be complicated by system calculation and synchronization issues
Calculated as basic salary plus allowance divided by working days, excluding weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence
A fixed divisor used to calculate daily wage by dividing monthly salary, instead of using exact calendar days
Calculation of salary reduction based on actual calendar days of absence, divided by total calendar days in the month
Method of calculating per-day salary by dividing total salary (basic or gross) by the number of working days
Total calendar days minus public holidays (e.g., in April, 22 total days minus 5 Eid holidays = 17 working days)

The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days including the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Calculation in Gratuity Computation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates one extra day in job tenure (622 vs 623 days), potentially affecting gratuity calculation precision. The platform captures 623 days instead of the expected 622 days when computing years of service.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. Users may misunderstand how daily wage is divided (31 vs 30 days) and resulting prorated salary amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When processing payroll earlier than the departure date, the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, there is a timing mismatch between Payroll and Time Off modules causing incorrect daily wage calculations. The system cannot recalculate deductions retroactively, leading to inconsistent salary deduction amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in the remarks section for February unpaid leave calculations, despite the backend calculation being mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave deductions. Instead of using Basic Salary / Working Days as configured, the system uses a global daily rate that calculates deductions using gross salary, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Display Across Payroll Months
claims_to_validate.statement: The system recalculates daily rates based on the payroll processing month instead of storing and displaying the rate from the original leave occurrence month, causing user confusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days per year divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. The payroll-side configuration always takes precedence.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Dependency in Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Counting
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years during service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations consistently produce amounts that are 0.1 or 0.2 less than expected when computing pro-rated End of Service amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Mid-Month Leave Accrual Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are only accrued at the end of the month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Service Duration Calculation Rules
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Computation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform uses a fixed divisor for daily wage calculation based on policy configuration, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Variation in Daily Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment calculations are based on working days, which means the daily wage rate changes each month depending on the number of working days

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot be automatically aligned

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration works correctly only when departure date is in the past, but fails when departure date is in the future

claims_to_validate.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not automatically reconcile or remove payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified or deleted.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave policy uses a fixed 30.42 day divisor instead of calendar days for daily wage calculation

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual calendar days in a month, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).

claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
